headline: Viatris Stock Slides After Phase 3 Blepharitis Drug Trial Misses Key Target
summary: The study did not meet its main endpoint of clearing eyelid debris in blepharitis patients.

raw.headline: Viatris Stock Slides After Phase 3 Blepharitis Drug Trial Misses Key Target
raw.summary: The study did not meet its main endpoint of clearing eyelid debris in blepharitis patients.

headline: Why Viatris (VTRS) Stock Is Falling Today
summary: Shares of medication company Viatris (NASDAQ:VTRS) fell 3.8% in the afternoon session after its experimental therapy for blepharitis, an inflammatory condition of the eyelids, failed to meet the main goal in a late-stage study.

raw.headline: Why Viatris (VTRS) Stock Is Falling Today

headline: Viatris Stock Tumbles as Eyelid Inflammation Treatment Misses Target
summary: Viatris  was falling Friday after the pharmaceutical company announced that its eye inflammation treatment didn’t meet its target in a late-stage trial.  Viatris  ’ ophthalmic ointment for patients with blepharitis, a condition causing irritation and swelling of the eyelids, failed to fully clear debris from the eyes in the six-week study, the company said.  Shares were falling 4.1% in premarket trading Friday following the announcement.

raw.headline: Viatris Stock Tumbles as Eyelid Inflammation Treatment Misses Target
raw.summary: Viatris  was falling Friday after the pharmaceutical company announced that its eye inflammation treatment didn’t meet its target in a late-stage trial.  Viatris  ’ ophthalmic ointment for patients with blepharitis, a condition causing irritation and swelling of the eyelids, failed to fully clear debris from the eyes in the six-week study, the company said.  Shares were falling 4.1% in premarket trading Friday following the announcement.

headline: Viatris Provides Update on Phase 3 Study of MR-139 for Blepharitis
summary: Viatris Inc. (Nasdaq: VTRS), a global healthcare company, today announced that a randomized, double-masked, vehicle-controlled, Phase 3 study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of pimecrolimus 0.3% (MR-139) ophthalmic ointment in subjects with blepharitis, did not meet its primary endpoint of complete resolution of debris after six weeks of twice daily dosing.
